valueFormat.notes: Configuration object defining the structure and behavior of dynamic content fields. Specifies available events, attributes, partners, and their metadata. Critical for controlling what content can be inserted.

commonMistakes.mistake: Not providing unique IDs for events and attributes
commonMistakes.why: Causes selection conflicts and duplicate entries in UI
commonMistakes.impact: Users cannot distinguish between similar items, selection state breaks
commonMistakes.fix: Ensure every event and attribute has a unique id property

valueFormat.notes: Currently selected dynamic content items. Represents the user's selections of events, attributes, and partners. Use v-model:dynamicContent for two-way binding.
Visual theme for the component. Affects background colors and contrast.
Color variant for visual styling and semantic meaning.
Size variant affecting spacing, typography, and overall dimensions.
Enables partner-level grouping/filtering. When true, shows partner selection UI and filters events/attributes by selected partners.
List of available partners for grouping/filtering. Only effective when hasGroupLevelPartners is true.
Enables constant/persistent event features. When true, shows UI for marking events as constants that persist across sessions/contexts.
Enables constant/persistent attribute features. When true, shows UI for marking attributes as constants.
Enables event grouping functionality. When true, shows checkbox/UI to toggle event grouping mode.
Current state of event grouping. When true, events are grouped. Use v-model:isGroupingEvents for two-way binding.
List of event IDs that should be displayed in grouped mode. Only relevant when isGroupingEvents is true.
Configuration for action buttons displayed in the component (save, cancel, clear, etc.). Defines button labels, variants, and callbacks.
Maximum height in pixels for scrollable content areas. When content exceeds this height, a scrollbar appears.
Number of items to load per chunk when lazy loading large lists. Improves performance for hundreds/thousands of events or attributes.
Number of chunks to preload ahead of current scroll position. Reduces perceived lag during scrolling.

setEventAsGrouped.description: Emitted when an event is added to or removed from the grouped events list
setEventAsGrouped.payload: { eventId: string | number, isGrouped: boolean } - Event ID and new grouped state
setEventAsGrouped.when: User toggles an event's grouped status in the UI

updateGroupingEvents.description: Emitted when the overall event grouping mode is toggled on or off
updateGroupingEvents.payload: boolean - New grouping state (true if grouping is now active)
updateGroupingEvents.when: User toggles the group events checkbox or grouping mode changes

basicUsage.title: Basic Dynamic Content Selection
basicUsage.description: Simple setup for event and attribute selection
basicUsage.code:
<template>
  <InDynamicContentBox
    id="dynamic-content-selector"
    v-model:dynamicContent="selections"
    :fieldsConfig="fieldsConfig"
    titleText="Select Events and Attributes"
    descriptionText="Choose which events and attributes to track"
  />
</template>

<script setup lang="ts">
import { ref } from 'vue';
import { InDynamicContentBox } from '@useinsider/design-system-vue';

const selections = ref({
  selectedEvents: [],
  selectedAttributes: [],
  selectedPartners: []
});

const fieldsConfig = {
  events: [
    { id: 'page_view', name: 'page_view', label: 'Page View', category: 'Page' },
    { id: 'click', name: 'click', label: 'Click', category: 'Interaction' },
    { id: 'purchase', name: 'purchase', label: 'Purchase', category: 'Conversion' }
  ],
  attributes: [
    { id: 'user.email', name: 'user.email', label: 'Email', category: 'User' },
    { id: 'user.name', name: 'user.name', label: 'Name', category: 'User' },
    { id: 'product.id', name: 'product.id', label: 'Product ID', category: 'Product' }
  ]
};
</script>

withPartners.title: Partner-Based Filtering
withPartners.code:
<template>
  <InDynamicContentBox
    id="partner-content-selector"
    v-model:dynamicContent="selections"
    :fieldsConfig="fieldsConfig"
    :hasGroupLevelPartners="true"
    :groupLevelPartners="partners"
    titleText="Configure Partner Integrations"
  />
</template>

<script setup lang="ts">
import { ref } from 'vue';
import { InDynamicContentBox } from '@useinsider/design-system-vue';

const selections = ref({
  selectedEvents: [],
  selectedAttributes: [],
  selectedPartners: ['google_analytics']
});

const partners = [
  {
    id: 'google_analytics',
    name: 'google_analytics',
    label: 'Google Analytics 4',
    enabled: true
  },
  {
    id: 'facebook_pixel',
    name: 'facebook_pixel',
    label: 'Meta Pixel',
    enabled: true
  },
  {
    id: 'mixpanel',
    name: 'mixpanel',
    label: 'Mixpanel',
    enabled: false
  }
];

const fieldsConfig = {
  events: [
    { id: 'page_view', name: 'page_view', label: 'Page View' },
    { id: 'purchase', name: 'purchase', label: 'Purchase' }
  ],
  attributes: [
    { id: 'user.id', name: 'user.id', label: 'User ID' },
    { id: 'revenue', name: 'revenue', label: 'Revenue' }
  ]
};
</script>

withGrouping.title: Event Grouping Configuration
withGrouping.description: Enable event grouping with custom messages
withGrouping.code:
<template>
  <InDynamicContentBox
    id="grouped-events-selector"
    v-model:dynamicContent="selections"
    v-model:isGroupingEvents="isGrouping"
    :fieldsConfig="fieldsConfig"
    :activateGroupingEvents="true"
    :groupedEvents="groupedEventIds"
    groupEventsCheckboxLabel="Enable grouped event tracking"
    groupEventsTooltip="Group related events together for better organization"
    groupingEventWarningText="Grouping will combine similar events"
    @updateGroupingEvents="handleGroupingChange"
    @setEventAsGrouped="handleEventGrouped"
  />
</template>

<script setup lang="ts">
import { ref } from 'vue';
import { InDynamicContentBox } from '@useinsider/design-system-vue';

const selections = ref({
  selectedEvents: ['page_view', 'product_view'],
  selectedAttributes: []
});

const isGrouping = ref(false);
const groupedEventIds = ref<string[]>([]);

const fieldsConfig = {
  events: [
    { id: 'page_view', name: 'page_view', label: 'Page View' },
    { id: 'product_view', name: 'product_view', label: 'Product View' },
    { id: 'category_view', name: 'category_view', label: 'Category View' },
    { id: 'search', name: 'search', label: 'Search' }
  ]
};

const handleGroupingChange = (enabled: boolean) => {
  console.log('Grouping', enabled ? 'enabled' : 'disabled');
  if (!enabled) {
    groupedEventIds.value = [];
  }
};

const handleEventGrouped = (event: { eventId: string; isGrouped: boolean }) => {
  if (event.isGrouped) {
    groupedEventIds.value.push(event.eventId);
  } else {
    groupedEventIds.value = groupedEventIds.value.filter(id => id !== event.eventId);
  }
};
</script>

cssVariables.notes: Uses design system variables for theming. Customize via theme and variant props.

classes.notes: Component applies size, theme, and variant-based classes automatically.

styling.customization: Use theme prop for light/dark mode. variant prop for color schemes. size prop for dimensions. fullWidthContentStatus for layout control.

examples.title: Complete Marketing Analytics Configurator
examples.description: Advanced configuration interface for selecting events, attributes, and partners with grouping and constant fields

implementationPatterns.name: Simple Event Selection Pattern
implementationPatterns.description: Basic event and attribute selection without advanced features
implementationPatterns.when: Need simple tracking configuration without partners or grouping
implementationPatterns.code:
<template>
  <InDynamicContentBox
    id="simple-selector"
    v-model:dynamicContent="selections"
    :fieldsConfig="config"
    titleText="Select Tracking Events"
    size="medium"
  />
</template>

<script setup lang="ts">
import { ref } from 'vue';
import { InDynamicContentBox } from '@useinsider/design-system-vue';

const selections = ref({ selectedEvents: [], selectedAttributes: [] });
const config = {
  events: [
    { id: 'click', name: 'click', label: 'Click Event' },
    { id: 'view', name: 'view', label: 'View Event' }
  ],
  attributes: [
    { id: 'user.id', name: 'user.id', label: 'User ID' }
  ]
};
</script>

implementationPatterns.name: Multi-Partner Integration Pattern
implementationPatterns.description: Configuration with multiple analytics partners and partner-specific filtering
implementationPatterns.when: Managing integrations with multiple analytics platforms simultaneously
implementationPatterns.code:
<template>
  <InDynamicContentBox
    id="multi-partner-config"
    v-model:dynamicContent="config"
    :fieldsConfig="fields"
    :hasGroupLevelPartners="true"
    :groupLevelPartners="partners"
    @partnerSelectionChanged="syncPartnerConfig"
  />
</template>

<script setup lang="ts">
import { ref, watch } from 'vue';
import { InDynamicContentBox } from '@useinsider/design-system-vue';

const config = ref({ selectedEvents: [], selectedPartners: [] });
const partners = ref([
  { id: 'ga', name: 'ga', label: 'Google Analytics' },
  { id: 'fb', name: 'fb', label: 'Facebook' }
]);
const fields = { events: [...], attributes: [...] };

const syncPartnerConfig = (selectedPartners: string[]) => {
  // Sync config to each partner's system
  selectedPartners.forEach(partnerId => {
    syncToPartner(partnerId, config.value);
  });
};
</script>

implementationPatterns.name: Lazy Loading for Large Datasets Pattern
implementationPatterns.description: Performance-optimized configuration for hundreds or thousands of events/attributes
implementationPatterns.when: Dealing with large catalogs of events or attributes (500+ items)
implementationPatterns.code:
<template>
  <InDynamicContentBox
    id="large-dataset-config"
    v-model:dynamicContent="selections"
    :fieldsConfig="lazyFields"
    :lazyLoadChunkSize="100"
    :preloadBunchSize="10"
    :maxChildHeight="400"
  />
</template>

<script setup lang="ts">
import { ref, computed } from 'vue';
import { InDynamicContentBox } from '@useinsider/design-system-vue';

const selections = ref({ selectedEvents: [] });

// Generate large dataset
const allEvents = Array.from({ length: 1000 }, (_, i) => ({
  id: `event_${i}`,
  name: `event_${i}`,
  label: `Event ${i}`,
  category: `Category ${Math.floor(i / 100)}`
}));

const lazyFields = computed(() => ({
  events: allEvents,
  attributes: []
}));
</script>
cons: Search may be slower on initial load

useCases.title: Marketing Analytics Platform Setup
useCases.description: Configure tracking events and user attributes for marketing analytics platforms like Google Analytics, Facebook Pixel, or Mixpanel
useCases.example: Marketing teams select which page views, button clicks, form submissions, and purchases to track. They choose user attributes (email, name, country) and product attributes (price, category) to include with each event. Partner filtering ensures only relevant events are sent to each platform.

useCases.title: Customer Data Platform (CDP) Configuration
useCases.description: Set up event and attribute mappings for CDPs to unify customer data across touchpoints
useCases.example: Data engineers configure which customer interaction events (login, purchase, support ticket) to ingest. They map customer attributes (lifetime value, segment, preferences) to create unified profiles. Constant attributes ensure critical IDs are always included.

useCases.title: A/B Testing Platform Integration
useCases.description: Select events and metrics for A/B testing experiments and variant tracking
useCases.example: Product managers choose conversion events (signup, purchase, retention) as experiment goals. They select user attributes (device type, location) for segmentation. Event grouping combines similar conversions for broader analysis.

useCases.title: Business Intelligence Dashboard Configuration
useCases.description: Choose metrics and dimensions for business intelligence dashboards and reports
useCases.example: Analysts select revenue events (purchase, subscription, upsell) and business attributes (product line, region, channel). They group related events (all purchase types) for unified reporting. Lazy loading handles thousands of potential metrics.

useCases.title: Data Warehouse ETL Setup
useCases.description: Configure which events and attributes to extract, transform, and load into data warehouses
useCases.example: Data engineers select operational events (inventory updates, order status changes) and business entities (products, customers, orders). Constant attributes ensure referential integrity. Partner selection routes data to different warehouse schemas.

useCases.title: Privacy Compliance Configuration
useCases.description: Manage which events and PII attributes are collected based on privacy regulations (GDPR, CCPA)
useCases.example: Compliance teams use constant attributes to mark required consent fields. They disable certain PII attributes (email, phone) for users who opt out. Event selection ensures only necessary tracking for legitimate business purposes.

bestPractices.title: Use Unique IDs for All Items
bestPractices.description: Ensure every event, attribute, and partner has a unique identifier to prevent selection conflicts
bestPractices.reasoning: Unique IDs prevent selection state bugs, ensure correct data mapping, and avoid confusion in the UI

bestPractices.title: Enable Lazy Loading for Large Datasets
bestPractices.description: Use lazyLoadChunkSize and preloadBunchSize when dealing with hundreds of events or attributes
bestPractices.code:
// For large catalogs (500+ items)
<InDynamicContentBox
  :fieldsConfig="largeEventCatalog"
  :lazyLoadChunkSize="100" // Load 100 items at a time
  :preloadBunchSize="10" // Preload 10 chunks ahead
  :maxChildHeight="400" // Fixed height for virtual scrolling
/>

// Result: Handles 1000+ items smoothly
bestPractices.reasoning: Lazy loading dramatically improves performance, reduces initial load time, and enables smooth scrolling with large datasets

bestPractices.title: Mark Critical Fields as Constant
bestPractices.description: Use isConstant flag for events/attributes that must always be tracked for data integrity
bestPractices.reasoning: Constant fields prevent accidental removal of critical data, ensure data consistency, and maintain referential integrity

bestPractices.title: Provide Clear Action Buttons
bestPractices.description: Configure buttonOptions with clear labels and appropriate variants for user actions
bestPractices.reasoning: Clear buttons guide users through the workflow, prevent accidental actions (via confirmation), and provide predictable outcomes

commonMistakes.mistake: Using duplicate IDs for events or attributes
commonMistakes.why: Component uses IDs for selection state tracking and data mapping
commonMistakes.impact: Selection state breaks, wrong items get selected/deselected, data corruption
commonMistakes.fix: Ensure every item has a globally unique ID, use prefixes like 'event_', 'attr_', 'partner_'

commonMistakes.mistake: Not enabling lazy loading for large datasets
commonMistakes.why: Rendering 1000+ items at once causes severe performance issues
commonMistakes.impact: UI freezes, slow scrolling, high memory usage, poor user experience
commonMistakes.fix: Enable lazy loading with appropriate chunk sizes for datasets over 200 items
commonMistakes.example:
// WRONG - renders all 1000 items immediately
<InDynamicContentBox :fieldsConfig="{ events: thousand Items }" />

// CORRECT - lazy loads in chunks
<InDynamicContentBox
  :fieldsConfig="{ events: thousandItems }"
  :lazyLoadChunkSize="100"
  :preloadBunchSize="10"
/>

commonMistakes.mistake: Missing categories for events and attributes
commonMistakes.why: Component groups items by category for better organization
commonMistakes.impact: All items appear in 'Uncategorized', difficult to find items, poor UX
commonMistakes.fix: Always provide meaningful category values for events and attributes

commonMistakes.why: Button actions often involve async operations that can fail
commonMistakes.impact: Errors swallowed silently, user thinks action succeeded when it failed, data loss
commonMistakes.fix: Implement proper error handling and user feedback in all button callbacks

commonMistakes.mistake: Forgetting to sync dynamicContent with v-model
commonMistakes.why: Component needs two-way binding to update parent state
commonMistakes.impact: Selections don't persist, parent component doesn't know what's selected

performanceNotes.description: Component supports lazy loading for large datasets to maintain performance
performanceNotes.recommendation: For datasets over 200 items, use lazyLoadChunkSize (50-100) and preloadBunchSize (5-10). For 1000+ items, use lazyLoadChunkSize=100 and preloadBunchSize=10.
performanceNotes.impact: Proper lazy loading can reduce initial render time from 5+ seconds to under 500ms for large datasets

performanceNotes.description: Setting maxChildHeight enables virtual scrolling for better performance
performanceNotes.recommendation: Set maxChildHeight to a reasonable value (300-500px) to enable virtual scrolling. Don't set it too large as it defeats the purpose.
performanceNotes.impact: Virtual scrolling can handle 10,000+ items smoothly while maintaining 60fps

performanceNotes.description: Avoid expensive operations in event handlers (setEventAsGrouped, updateGroupingEvents)
performanceNotes.recommendation: If handlers perform expensive operations (API calls, complex calculations), debounce them or use async queuing.
performanceNotes.impact: Unbounded event handlers can cause UI lag during rapid selection changes

accessibilityNotes.description: Component supports full keyboard navigation for selecting events and attributes
accessibilityNotes.recommendation: Ensure Tab, Arrow keys, Space, and Enter work for all selections. Test with keyboard-only navigation.
accessibilityNotes.example:
// Component handles keyboard navigation automatically
// Test: Tab through items, Space/Enter to select, Arrow keys to navigate lists

accessibilityNotes.description: Selection changes and grouping state should be announced to screen readers
accessibilityNotes.recommendation: Use aria-live regions for dynamic selection updates. Ensure labels clearly describe item purpose.

accessibilityNotes.description: Focus should be managed when opening/closing sections or applying filters
accessibilityNotes.recommendation: Return focus to trigger element after modal-like interactions. Maintain focus within component during keyboard navigation.

accessibilityNotes.description: All interactive elements need clear, descriptive labels
accessibilityNotes.recommendation: Use titleText and descriptionText props. Provide tooltips for complex features. Use meaningful button labels.
accessibilityNotes.example:
<InDynamicContentBox
  titleText="Configure Analytics Events"
  descriptionText="Select which user actions to track in your analytics platform"
  groupEventsTooltip="Group similar events together for simplified reporting"
/>

helperFunctions.name: useDynamicContentManager
helperFunctions.description: Composable for managing dynamic content state with validation, save/load, and change tracking
parameters: options: { onSave, onLoad, validateBeforeSave } - Configuration options
helperFunctions.returnType: { content, isDirty, hasSelections, saving, loading, error, validate, save, load, reset, clear }

helperFunctions.name: createFieldsConfigFromAPI
helperFunctions.description: Helper to transform API response into fieldsConfig format with proper typing and validation
parameters: apiEvents: APIEvent[] - Events from API response
apiAttributes: APIAttribute[] - Attributes from API response
apiPartners?: any[] - Optional partners from API
